title: Mike Carey: My Faith in Frankie (Vertigo|2004|Digital-HR|Empire)
description:
" A jealous god or a boyfriend back from the dead. Who would YOU choose? "

       - Tagline, "My Faith in Frankie" issue one

 " Frankie is adorable like a young Audrey Hepburn. "

       - The Washington Post

---

So, this is what's generically called a "romantic comedy with a supernatural twist". Which sounds really lame, but is actually one of the most irreverently hilarious comics I've ever read, in a "Calvin and Hobbes meet Terry Pratchett" kind of way.

The required rom-com feel-good factor is definitely there as well, though. Really, the only criticism I can come up with is that the book is too bloody short - the premise could easily have supported something with a bit more heft, in my estimation.

If the author's name is not immediately familiar, Mike Carey has also written "The Unwritten" (pun? what pun?) and "Lucifer" - which, as it happens, are both contained in the latest Weeklies, woot!

---

This is a single volume compiled from the Digital Hi-Res re-releases by Tithe-Empire.
